lsevents.c

00001 #include "pgpmac.h"
00010 #define LSEVENTS_QUEUE_LENGTH 256
00011 
00012 typedef struct lsevents_queue_struct {
00013   char event[LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH];    
00014 } lsevents_queue_t;
00015 
00016 static lsevents_queue_t lsevents_queue[LSEVENTS_QUEUE_LENGTH];
00017 static unsigned int lsevents_queue_on  = 0;
00018 static unsigned int lsevents_queue_off = 0;
00019 
00020 typedef struct lsevents_listener_struct {
00021   struct lsevents_listener_struct *next;        
00022   char event[LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH];            
00023   void (*cb)( char *);                          
00024 } lsevents_listener_t;
00025 
00026 static lsevents_listener_t *lsevents_listeners_p = NULL;
00027 
00028 static pthread_t       lsevents_thread;                 
00029 static pthread_mutex_t lsevents_listener_mutex;         
00030 static pthread_mutex_t lsevents_queue_mutex;            
00031 static pthread_cond_t  lsevents_queue_cond;             
00032 
00033 void lsevents_send_event( char *fmt, ...) {
00034   char event[LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH];
00035   char *sp;
00036   va_list arg_ptr;
00037 
00038   va_start( arg_ptr, fmt);
00039   vsnprintf( event, sizeof(event)-1, fmt, arg_ptr);
00040   event[sizeof(event)-1]=0;
00041   va_end( arg_ptr);
00042 
00043   lslogging_log_message( "lsevents_send_event: %s", event);
00044 
00045   pthread_mutex_lock( &lsevents_queue_mutex);
00046 
00047   // maybe wait for room on the queue
00048   while( lsevents_queue_on + 1 == lsevents_queue_off)
00049     pthread_cond_wait( &lsevents_queue_cond, &lsevents_queue_mutex);
00050   
00051   sp = lsevents_queue[(lsevents_queue_on++) % LSEVENTS_QUEUE_LENGTH].event;
00052   strncpy( sp, event, LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH);
00053   sp[LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH - 1] = 0;
00054 
00055   pthread_cond_signal(  &lsevents_queue_cond);
00056   pthread_mutex_unlock( &lsevents_queue_mutex);
00057 
00058 }
00059 
00060 
00061 void lsevents_add_listener( char *event, void (*cb)(char *)) {
00062   lsevents_listener_t *new;
00063 
00064   new = calloc( 1, sizeof( lsevents_listener_t));
00065   if( new == NULL) {
00066     lslogging_log_message( "lsevents_add_listener: out of memory");
00067     exit( -1);
00068   }
00069 
00070   strncpy( new->event, event, LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH);
00071   new->event[LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH-1] = 0;
00072   new->cb   = cb;
00073   new->next = lsevents_listeners_p;
00074 
00075   pthread_mutex_lock( &lsevents_listener_mutex);
00076   lsevents_listeners_p = new;
00077   pthread_mutex_unlock( &lsevents_listener_mutex);
00078 
00079   lslogging_log_message( "lsevents_add_listener: added listener for event %s", event);
00080 
00081 }
00082 
00083 void lsevents_remove_listener (char *event, void (*cb)(char *)) {
00084   
00085   lsevents_listener_t *last, *current;
00086 
00087   //
00088   // Find the listener to remove
00089   // and unlink it from the list
00090   //
00091   pthread_mutex_lock( &lsevents_listener_mutex);
00092   last = NULL;
00093   for( current = lsevents_listeners_p; current != NULL; current = current->next) {
00094     if( strcmp( last->event, event) == 0 && last->cb == cb) {
00095       if( last == NULL) {
00096         lsevents_listeners_p = current->next;
00097       } else {
00098         last->next = current->next;
00099       }
00100       break;
00101     }
00102   }
00103   pthread_mutex_unlock( &lsevents_listener_mutex);
00104 
00105   //
00106   // Now remove it
00107   // TODO: use saner memory management where we allocate many listeners at a time
00108   // as an array and then just flag the ones that are used
00109   //
00110   if( current != NULL) {
00111     if( current->event != NULL)
00112       free( current->event);
00113     free(current);
00114   }
00115 }
00116 
00117 void *lsevents_worker(
00118                      void *dummy
00119                      ) {
00120   
00121   char event[LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH];
00122   lsevents_queue_t *ep;
00123   lsevents_listener_t *p;
00124 
00125   while( 1) {
00126     pthread_mutex_lock( &lsevents_queue_mutex);
00127 
00128     //
00129     // wait for someone to send an event
00130     //
00131     while( lsevents_queue_off == lsevents_queue_on)
00132       pthread_cond_wait( &lsevents_queue_cond, &lsevents_queue_mutex);
00133 
00134     //
00135     // copy event string since the value in the queue may change when
00136     // we unlock the mutex
00137     //
00138     ep = &(lsevents_queue[(lsevents_queue_off++) % LSEVENTS_QUEUE_LENGTH]);
00139     strncpy( event, ep->event, LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH);
00140     event[LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH-1] = 0;
00141 
00142     //
00143     // let the send event process know there is room on the queue again
00144     //
00145     pthread_cond_signal(  &lsevents_queue_cond);
00146     pthread_mutex_unlock( &lsevents_queue_mutex);
00147 
00148     //
00149     // Find the callbacks and, well, call them back
00150     //
00151     pthread_mutex_lock( &lsevents_listener_mutex);
00152     for( p = lsevents_listeners_p; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
00153       if( strcmp( event, p->event) == 0) {
00154         p->cb( p->event);
00155       }
00156     }
00157 
00158     pthread_mutex_unlock( &lsevents_listener_mutex);
00159   }
00160   return NULL;
00161 }
00162 
00163 void lsevents_init() {
00164   pthread_mutex_init( &lsevents_queue_mutex, NULL);
00165   pthread_cond_init(  &lsevents_queue_cond, NULL);
00166   pthread_mutex_init( &lsevents_listener_mutex, NULL);
00167 }
00168 
00169 void lsevents_run() {
00170   pthread_create( &lsevents_thread, NULL, lsevents_worker, NULL);
00171 }
